org.rootsdev.polygenea.nodes

Class Citation

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.rootsdev.polygenea.Node
      • org.rootsdev.polygenea.nodes.Citation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Node>

    public class Citation
extends Node
    A Citation node represents a pointer from the digital system to the physical world. Citations are unique among polygenea nodes in that they have an unbounded number of partially-constrained fields, realized in this implementation in the details field. This general form allows the user to provide as much information as they wish, so if for example they want to provide ISBN-10 and ISBN-13 and DOI and publisher and a visual description of the book binding binding and latitude/longitude of the archive where it is found and so on, they may.

    At some point FHISO will probably produce a standardised list of citation keys and acceptable formatting of their values, but that will be a sufficient set rather than the only fields permitted.

    Author:
    Luther Tychonievich. Released into the public domain. I would consider it a courtesy if you cite me if you benefit from this code.

    • Field Detail

      • details

        public final java.util.SortedMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> details
        Our best description of the real-world existence of the thing being cited.

        Unlike other Node fields, this one will be merged with the overall JSON, not included as a "details" entry.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Citation

        public Citation(java.util.SortedMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> map,
                NodeLookup lookup)
        Constructor used by JSON loading methods in Node and Database
        Parameters:
        map - A JSON object of this node
        lookup - How to resolve node references into Node objects (ignored)
        Throws:
        JSONParser.MalformedJSONException - if the data is not proper JSON
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if JSON is not a Node or list of Nodes.

      • Citation

        public Citation(java.lang.String key1,
                java.lang.Object val1,
                java.lang.Object... fields)
        A convenience constructor allowing the key:value mapping to be specified inline.
        Parameters:
        key1 - The first key string (separate to make this method unambiguously different from the JSON constructor)
        val1 - The value that goes with that key
        fields - An even number of Strings; the 1st, 3rd, etc are keys and the 2nd, 4th, etc are the corresponding values.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any key starts with a '!' or is a duplicate of another key

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        public boolean validate(java.lang.StringBuilder log)
        Description copied from class: Node
        Performs any validation that the node might need. The Node class just checks the UUID. Subclasses should override this method to perform any additional validation they might need, such as verifying that fields are not null.
        Overrides:
        validate in class Node
        Parameters:
        log - A place where descriptions of problems will be written. If the node is valid, log is not used.
        Returns:
        true if the node is valid, false otherwise.
